children.value: Sourcegraph is the standard developer platform for code search and navigation at many of the largest and most advanced technology companies. With Sourcegraph, every company has access to the same kind of tools that Google and Facebook developers use every day.

Every detail that changed in this release
Sourcegraph couldn‚Äôt be what it is without the community.

hProperties.aria-label: Improved autocompletion for search query filters permalink

children.value: Improved autocompletion for search query filters
View on Vimeo
Autocomplete suggestions make it easier to use filters in your Sourcegraph searches. Use

to trigger suggestions for filters you can apply to your query. As you type, the suggestions become more relevant, helping you to apply correct filter options or autocomplete repository or file names.

hProperties.aria-label: Sourcegraph provides native code intelligence to GitLab permalink

children.value: Sourcegraph provides native code intelligence to GitLab
View on Vimeo

to take advantage of go-to-definition and find references on their code hosts. GitLab recognizes the value this brings to developer productivity and has partnered with Sourcegraph to provide this functionality natively to all GitLab users. Read our

Soon, GitLab.com users will be able to opt-in to native code intelligence for public repositories by enabling Sourcegraph in their user preferences. This feature is being rolled out incrementally to public projects on GitLab.com, and will first be available on the
Users with private GitLab instances or repositories can enable Sourcegraph code intelligence as of GitLab 12.5. Take a look at the
for how to configure it on your instance.

hProperties.aria-label: Create cross repository search and replace campaigns permalink

children.value: Create cross-repository search and replace campaigns
View on Vimeo

Sourcegraph now supports creating and tracking code-aware search and replace campaigns on GitHub and Bitbucket Server. When running a search and replace campaign, you can preview the changes across repositories and then generate the corresponding pull requests on your GitHub and Bitbucket Server instances. Once created, you can track the PRs to completion in a burndown chart.

for automated search and replace campaigns. Comby syntax is code-aware and simplifies finding patterns in code. This new capability makes operations that could require complex or awkward regexp queries much simpler to write.
For example, to change how errors are logged throughout your code, like in
this commit in the Go source

// match:
errors.New(fmt.Sprintf(:[args]))

// replace:
fmt.Errorf(:[args])
Code change management campaigns are in private beta.

hProperties.aria-label: Precise LSIF based code intelligence for 5 languages permalink

children.value: Precise LSIF-based code intelligence for 5 languages
With the completion of the Java LSIF indexer, LSIF-based precise code intelligence now supports five languages: Go, Typescript, Java, C++, and Python. See
for the most up-to-date information on the list of languages with LSIF indexers.
We are looking for feedback from project owners interested in trying out precise code intelligence! Use our new
to try it out manually before adding it as a step in your CI.

hProperties.aria-label: Scaling search for our largest customers permalink

children.value: Scaling search for our largest customers

Customers wanting better indexed search performance or wishing to add many more thousands of repositories to Sourcegraph are now in luck! Sourcegraph‚Äôs indexed search can now scale horizontally in cluster deployments.

hProperties.aria-label: Fully automated release testing process permalink

children.value: As part of Sourcegraph‚Äôs ongoing commitment to providing the highest quality, stable releases, our manual QA process has in the last two months been turned into a fully automated regression testing suite. We continue to aggressively invest in automated testing of Sourcegraph to provide extremely stable and reliable releases, and ultimately better features for our users. Look forward to reading more about this in an upcoming blogpost from Sourcegraph CTO, Beyang Liu,
Indexed Search supports horizontally scaling. Instances with large number of repositories can update the
Docker deployments now support the environment variable

. If set to true the container will keep running, even if a subprocess has died. This is useful when manually fixing problems in the container which the container refuses to start. For example a bad database migration.

Directory names on the repository tree page are now shown in bold to improve readability.
Added support for Bitbucket Server pull request activity to the
burndown chart. When used, this feature leads to more requests being sent to Bitbucket Server, since Sourcegraph needs to keep track of how a pull request‚Äôs state changes over time. With
, this additional load will be significantly reduced in the future.

The experimental search pagination API no longer omits a single repository worth of results at the end of the result set.
The experimental search pagination API no longer produces search cursors that can get ‚Äústuck‚Äù.
